result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[ma] Case called at 2:04pm {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.} 
Defendant Demond R Turner appeared by zoom.  Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer appeared by zoom for Demond R Turner.  Attorney Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared by zoom for State of Wisconsin. WCS Representative, Jonathan Reinke appears via zoom. 

The Court finds that the Zoom video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

recess: 2:08pm--reconvene: 2:11pm 
On SCRAM Violations: 
--Arguments given by Atty Fischer 
--Arguments given by ADA Shock

The Court requires Mr. Turner to post an additional $1500 by noon tomorrow (11/4/22), special conditions are unchanged. 

Scheduling is discussed.
recess: 2:27pm

[MK] case called at 9:53am 
Defendant Demond R Turner in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer.  ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Fischer indicates there is not an agreement. Attorney Fischer requests the scheduling of a motion hearing. 
The Court directs Attorney Fischer to file the intended motion; the Court will issue a Briefly Schedule thereafter. 
The Court raises the 10/18/22 WCS letter-notice regarding Scram violations.  ADA Teuber indicates she was not aware of the letter-notice; the State takes no position. Attorney Fischer notes that the date of the last alleged violation was October 8th, and the Court held a hearing and modified bond after that date. 
recess 9:57am 

NEXT:  Attorney Fischer will be filing a motion to suppress based on stop; thereafter the Court intends to issue a briefly schedule  [JA- please set Court's own review for this filing and action; no future scheduling was issued at this hearing]
Court's Response to 10/18/22 Letter from WCS: This will be taken up at the 10/20/22 proceedings

Amended

2:14 PM. Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Demond R Turner in court.  Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer in court for Demond R Turner.  Attorney Jeffrey Martin Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. Jonathan Reinke (WCS) appears by phone. 

Statement as to status presented by counsel. 
Court establishes that the defense is opposed to bond modification. 
Arguments presented by counsel. 

J. Reinke sworn and testifies: (by Zoom)
-  direct examination by ADA Shock
-  cross examination by Atty. Fischer
-  examination by the Court
-  redirect examination by ADA Shock
-  recross examination by Atty. Fischer

The Court orders that the bond be amended so that the Defendant post an additional $1,000.00 CASH with all the same conditions as previously ordered. 
Case continued as previously scheduled. 

Recess 2:31pm.
Motion hearing on October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[MK] case called at 10:26am 
Defendant Demond R Turner in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer.  ADA Krysta Parson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
WCS staffperson J. Reinke is present by Zoom video-conference. 

This hearing is scheduled on the WCS letter-notice regarding payment of Scram monitoring fees.  
Mr. Reinke indicates that Mr. Turner made a significant payment recently; his balance due is currently $440. Because of the recent payment, WCS is not asking that the Court take any action. 

ADA Parson raises that WCS has filed a Notice regarding multiple Scram violations [filing date 10/4/22].  ADA Parson orally Motions for Bond Modification. 
Attorney Fischer indicates that the Defense is denying any alcohol consumption. 
Arguments are given by counsel.  During these arguments, ADA Parson requests the issuance of a Warrant under Statute 968.091.
After Attorney Fischer voices objections as to notice, the Court schedules the hearing on the motions to a different date. 
recess 10:34am

NEXT:  (1) Motion Hearing (on the State's oral Motions for Bond Modification and for Issuance of a Warrant under St. 968.091) on October 10th at 2:00pm  (2) the October 20th Status Conference remains on the Court's calendar

[MK] case called at 8:40am 
Defendant Demond R Turner in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer. DA Monica Hall in court for the State of Wisconsin.  

Officer L. Muehlenkamp- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by DA Hall
--Sate's Exhibit #1: State Hygiene Lab Report- offered and received
--cross examination by Attorney Fischer
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Turner committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" is entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--to comply with Scram alcohol monitoring.  Mr. Turner is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. Atty Kosloske gives explanation for Mr. Turner's non-appearances, gives bond arguments. 

The Court will address WCS Non-Compliance on a later date.

The Court requires $500 CASH bond, with same non-moneary conditions.

[MK] case called at 9:15am 
Defendant Demond R Turner not in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Today's Motion Hearing is scheduled on the State's 4/12/22 Motion to Modify Bond. 
ADA Shock indicates that WCS staff have indicated that Mr. Turner is still not in WCS compliance.
On Motion of the State, the Court issues a Warrant-Body Only, returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate.  
recess 9:16am
JA calendar for hrg: 4/21/2022 @ 8:30 am
Motion hearing on April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Modify Bond SCRAM violation
Hearing on May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
SCRAM Program Non-Compliance
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Conditions of Bond include: 
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--to comply with Scram alcohol monitoring.  Mr. Turner is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

[MK] case called at 1:40 pm 
Defendant Demond R Turner appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.  Public Defender Cassi Nelson is present, indicating that Mr. Turner has declined  PD eligibility determination, and Mr. Turner has expressed that he wishes to proceed without an attorney today.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Complaint admitted; the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel is given.  Mr. Turner indicate he intends to hire counsel. He requests sixty days to do so. 
On agreement of the parties, the Court schedules Preliminary Hearing on May 10th. 

Arguments are given on bond by ADA Shock and by Mr. Turner. 
The Court requires a $1,500 Signature Bond with conditions:
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--to comply with Scram alcohol monitoring.  Mr. Turner is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
recess 1:50 pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on May 10th at 8:30am
